CPSC 203.name: CPSC 203
CPSC 203.prereqText: One of CPSC 103, CPSC 110, EOSC 211, MATH 210, PHYS 210, COMM 337.
CPSC 203.title: Programming, Problem Solving, and Algorithms

CPSC 221.name: CPSC 221
CPSC 221.prereqText: One of CPSC 210, EECE 210, CPEN 221 and one of CPSC 121, MATH 220.
CPSC 221.title: Basic Algorithms and Data Structures

CPSC 259.name: CPSC 259
CPSC 259.title: Data Structures and Algorithms for Electrical Engineers

CPSC 261.name: CPSC 261
CPSC 261.prereqText: One of EECE 259, CPEN 211 and one of EECE 210, CPEN 221.
CPSC 261.title: Basics of Computer Systems

CPSC 302.name: CPSC 302
CPSC 302.prereqText: One of CPSC 103, CPSC 110, CPEN 221, EOSC 211, PHYS 210 and one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.
CPSC 302.title: Numerical Computation for Algebraic Problems

CPSC 303.name: CPSC 303
CPSC 303.prereqText: One of CPSC 103, CPSC 110, CPEN 221, EOSC 211, PHYS 210 and one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.
CPSC 303.title: Numerical Approximation and Discretization

CPSC 312.name: CPSC 312
CPSC 312.prereqText: One of CPSC 210, EECE 210, EECE 309, CPEN 221.
CPSC 312.title: Functional and Logic Programming

CPSC 314.name: CPSC 314
CPSC 314.prereqText: CPSC 221 and one of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.
CPSC 314.title: Computer Graphics

CPSC 320.name: CPSC 320
CPSC 320.prereqText: CPSC 221 and at least 3 credits from COMM 291, BIOL 300, MATH or STAT at 200 level or above.
CPSC 320.title: Intermediate Algorithm Design and Analysis

CPSC 330.name: CPSC 330
CPSC 330.prereqText: Either (a) one of CPSC 203, CPSC 210, CPEN 221 or (b) MATH 210 and one of CPSC 107, CPSC 110.
CPSC 330.title: Applied Machine Learning

CPSC 340.name: CPSC 340
CPSC 340.prereqText: CPSC 221 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223 and one of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254 and one of STAT 241, STAT 251, ECON 325, ECON 327, MATH 302, STAT 302, MATH 318.
CPSC 340.title: Machine Learning and Data Mining

CPSC 344.name: CPSC 344
CPSC 344.prereqText: One of CPSC 210, EECE 210, EECE 309, CPEN 221.
CPSC 344.title: Introduction to Human Computer Interaction Methods

CPSC 404.name: CPSC 404
CPSC 404.prereqText: CPSC 304 and one of CPSC 213, CPSC 261.
CPSC 404.title: Advanced Relational Databases

CPSC 410.name: CPSC 410
CPSC 410.prereqText: Either (a) CPSC 310 or (b) one of EECE 310, CPEN 321 and one of EECE 315, CPEN 331.
CPSC 410.title: Advanced Software Engineering

CPSC 416.name: CPSC 416
CPSC 416.prereqText: One of CPSC 313, EECE 315, CPEN 331 and one of CPSC 317, EECE 358, ELEC 331.
CPSC 416.title: Distributed Systems

CPSC 417.name: CPSC 417
CPSC 417.prereqText: All of CPSC 313, CPSC 317 and one of STAT 200, STAT 241.
CPSC 417.title: Computer Networking

CPSC 418.name: CPSC 418
CPSC 418.prereqText: One of CPSC 261, CPSC 313, EECE 476, CPEN 411 and one of CPSC 320, EECE 320.
CPSC 418.title: Parallel Computation

CPSC 427.name: CPSC 427
CPSC 427.prereqText: CPSC 221 and one of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.
CPSC 427.title: Video Game Programming

CPSC 430.name: CPSC 430
CPSC 430.prereqText: 3 credits of Computer Science and at least third-year standing.
CPSC 430.title: Computers and Society

CPSC 444.name: CPSC 444
CPSC 444.prereqText: CPSC 344 and one of STAT 200, STAT 203, STAT 241, STAT 251, BIOL 300, COMM 291, ECON 325, ECON 327, FRST 231, GEOG 374, KIN  206, KIN  371, POLI 380, PSYC 218, PSYC 278, PSYC 366, SOCI 328.
CPSC 444.title: Advanced Methods for Human Computer Interaction

CPSC 445.name: CPSC 445
CPSC 445.prereqText: CPSC 320 and either BMEG 250 or six credits of BIOL beyond BIOL 111.
CPSC 445.title: Algorithms in Bioinformatics

CPSC 491.name: CPSC 491
CPSC 491.prereqText: All of CPSC 221, CPSC 310, CPSC 344 and Third-year standing.
CPSC 491.title: Interactive Digital Media Practicum

MATH 100.name: MATH 100
MATH 100.prereqText: High-school calculus and one of (a) a score of 80% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12, or (b) a satisfactory score in the UBC Mathematics Basic Skills Test.
MATH 100.title: Differential Calculus with Applications to Physical Sciences and Engineering

MATH 101.name: MATH 101
MATH 101.prereqs: MATH 100 || MATH 102 || MATH 104 || MATH 110 || MATH 120 || MATH 180 || MATH 184
MATH 101.prereqText: One of MATH 100, MATH 102, MATH 104, MATH 110, MATH 120, MATH 180, MATH 184.
MATH 101.title: Integral Calculus with Applications to Physical Sciences and Engineering

MATH 102.name: MATH 102
MATH 102.prereqText: High-school calculus and one of (a) a grade of 80% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12, or (b) a satisfactory score in the UBC Mathematics Basic Skills Test.
MATH 102.title: Differential Calculus with Applications to Life Sciences

MATH 103.name: MATH 103
MATH 103.prereqs: MATH 100 || MATH 102 || MATH 104 || MATH 110 || MATH 120 || MATH 180 || MATH 184
MATH 103.prereqText: One of MATH 100, MATH 102, MATH 104, MATH 110, MATH 120, MATH 180, MATH 184.
MATH 103.title: Integral Calculus with Applications to Life Sciences

MATH 104.name: MATH 104
MATH 104.prereqText: High-school calculus and one of (a) a grade of 80% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12  or Pre-calculus 12, or (b) a satisfactory score in the UBC Mathematics Basic Skills Test.
MATH 104.title: Differential Calculus with Applications to Commerce and Social Sciences

MATH 105.name: MATH 105
MATH 105.prereqs: MATH 100 || MATH 102 || MATH 104 || MATH 110 || MATH 120 || MATH 180 || MATH 184
MATH 105.prereqText: One of MATH 100, MATH 102, MATH 104, MATH 110, MATH 120, MATH 180, MATH 184.
MATH 105.title: Integral Calculus with Applications to Commerce and Social Sciences

MATH 110.name: MATH 110
MATH 110.prereqText: BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12 (or equivalent), plus permission of  the Mathematics Department;  permission will normally be based on a low grade in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12 (or equivalent) and a low score in the optional UBC Mathematics Basic Skills Test if taken. See http://www.math.ubc.ca/Ugrad/m110.shtml for details.
MATH 110.title: Differential Calculus

MATH 120.name: MATH 120
MATH 120.prereqText: High-school calculus and one of (a) a score of 95% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12; or (b) permission from the Mathematics Department Head.
MATH 120.title: Honours Differential Calculus

MATH 121.name: MATH 121
MATH 121.prereqs: MATH 120 || MATH 100 || MATH 102 || MATH 104 || MATH 180 || MATH 184
MATH 121.prereqText: Either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 120 or (b) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH 100, MATH 102, MATH 104, MATH 180, MATH 184 or (c) a score of 5 in AP Calculus AB.
MATH 121.title: Honours Integral Calculus

MATH 180.name: MATH 180
MATH 180.prereqText: One of BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12 and one of (a) a grade of 80% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12, (b) a satisfactory score in the UBC Mathematics Basic Skills Test.
MATH 180.title: Differential Calculus with Physical Applications

MATH 184.name: MATH 184
MATH 184.prereqText: One of BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12 and one of (a) a grade of 80% or higher in BC Principles of Mathematics 12 or Pre-calculus 12, or (b) a satisfactory score in the UBC Mathematics Basic Skills Test.
MATH 184.title: Differential Calculus for Social Science and Commerce

MATH 200.name: MATH 200
MATH 200.prereqText: One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001.
MATH 200.title: Calculus III

MATH 210.name: MATH 210
MATH 210.prereqText: One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001.
MATH 210.title: Introduction to Mathematical Computing

MATH 215.name: MATH 215
MATH 215.prereqText: One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.
MATH 215.title: Elementary Differential Equations I

MATH 217.name: MATH 217
MATH 217.prereqText: A score of 68% or higher in one of PHYS 102, PHYS 108, PHYS 118, PHYS 153, PHYS 158, SCIE 001 and a score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001.
MATH 217.title: Multivariable and Vector Calculus

MATH 220.name: MATH 220
MATH 220.prereqs: MATH 101 || MATH 103 || MATH 105 || MATH 121 || MATH 200 || MATH 217 || MATH 226 || MATH 253 || MATH 254
MATH 220.prereqText: Either (a) a score of 64% or higher in one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, SCIE 001 or (b) one of MATH 121, MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254.
MATH 220.title: Mathematical Proof

MATH 221.name: MATH 221
MATH 221.prereqs: MATH 100 || MATH 102 || MATH 104 || MATH 110 || MATH 120 || MATH 180 || MATH 184 || MATH 101 || MATH 103 || MATH 105 || MATH 121
MATH 221.prereqText: Either (a) a score of 64% or higher in one of MATH 100, MATH 102, MATH 104, MATH 110, MATH 120, MATH 180, MATH 184 or (b) one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001 or (c) advanced credit for MATH 100.
MATH 221.title: Matrix Algebra

MATH 223.name: MATH 223
MATH 223.prereqText: Either (a) MATH 121 or (b) a score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, SCIE 001.
MATH 223.title: Linear Algebra

MATH 226.name: MATH 226
MATH 226.prereqText: Either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 121 or (b) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, SCIE 001.
MATH 226.title: Advanced Calculus I

MATH 227.name: MATH 227
MATH 227.prereqText: A score of 68% or higher in MATH 226.
MATH 227.title: Advanced Calculus II

MATH 253.name: MATH 253
MATH 253.prereqText: One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001.
MATH 253.title: Multivariable Calculus

MATH 254.name: MATH 254
MATH 254.prereqText: MATH 101 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.
MATH 254.title: Multivariable and Vector Calculus for Mechanical Engineering

MATH 255.name: MATH 255
MATH 255.prereqText: One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.
MATH 255.title: Ordinary Differential Equations

MATH 256.name: MATH 256
MATH 256.prereqText: One of MATH 101, MATH 103, MATH 105, MATH 121, SCIE 001 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.
MATH 256.title: Differential Equations

MATH 257.name: MATH 257
MATH 257.prereqText: One of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.
MATH 257.title: Partial Differential Equations

MATH 258.name: MATH 258
MATH 258.prereqText: MATH 101 and one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223.
MATH 258.title: Differential Equations for Mechanical Engineering

MATH 264.name: MATH 264
MATH 264.prereqText: One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254.
MATH 264.title: Vector Calculus for Electrical Engineering

MATH 300.name: MATH 300
MATH 300.prereqText: One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254.
MATH 300.title: Introduction to Complex Variables

MATH 301.name: MATH 301
MATH 301.prereqText: One of MATH 300, MATH 305 and one of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.
MATH 301.title: Applied Analysis

MATH 302.name: MATH 302
MATH 302.prereqText: One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254.
MATH 302.title: Introduction to Probability

MATH 305.name: MATH 305
MATH 305.prereqs: (MATH 200 || MATH 217 || MATH 226 || MATH 253 || MATH 254) && (MATH 215 || MATH 255 || MATH 256 || MATH 258)
MATH 305.prereqText: One of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254 and one of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.
MATH 305.title: Applied Complex Analysis

MATH 307.name: MATH 307
MATH 307.prereqs: (MATH 152 || MATH 221 || MATH 223) && (MATH 200 || MATH 217 || MATH 226 || MATH 253 || MATH 254)
MATH 307.prereqText: One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223 and one of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254.
MATH 307.title: Applied Linear Algebra

MATH 309.name: MATH 309
MATH 309.prereqText: Either (a) one of MATH 152, MATH 221 and one of MATH 220, MATH 226, CPSC 121;  or (b) MATH 223.
MATH 309.title: Topics in Geometry

MATH 312.name: MATH 312
MATH 312.prereqText: One of MATH 220, MATH 223, MATH 226, CPSC 121 and 9 additional credits of mathematics courses.
MATH 312.title: Introduction to Number Theory

MATH 316.name: MATH 316
MATH 316.prereqText: One of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.
MATH 316.title: Elementary Differential Equations II

MATH 317.name: MATH 317
MATH 317.prereqText: One of MATH 200, MATH 226, MATH 253. One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223 is recommended.
MATH 317.title: Calculus IV

MATH 318.name: MATH 318
MATH 318.prereqText: One of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223 and one of MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.
MATH 318.title: Probability with Physical Applications

MATH 320.name: MATH 320
MATH 320.prereqText: Either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 226 or (b) one of MATH 200, MATH 217, MATH 226, MATH 253, MATH 254 and a score of 80% or higher in MATH 220.
MATH 320.title: Real Variables I

MATH 322.name: MATH 322
MATH 322.prereqText: Either (a) a score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 223, MATH 310 or (b) one of MATH 152, MATH 221, MATH 223 and a score of 80% or higher in MATH 220.
MATH 322.title: Introduction to Group Theory

MATH 341.name: MATH 341
MATH 341.prereqText: One of MATH 220, MATH 223, MATH 226, CPSC 121.
MATH 341.title: Introduction to Discrete Mathematics

MATH 342.name: MATH 342
MATH 342.prereqText: Either (a) one of MATH 152, MATH 221 and one of MATH 220, MATH 226, CPSC 121;  or (b) MATH 223.
MATH 342.title: Algebra and Coding Theory

MATH 344.name: MATH 344
MATH 344.prereqText: Either (a) one of MATH 152, MATH 221 and one of MATH 220, MATH 226, CPSC 121;  or (b) MATH 223.
MATH 344.title: Mathematical Game Theory

MATH 361.name: MATH 361
MATH 361.prereqText: One of BIOL 301, MATH 215, MATH 255, MATH 256, MATH 258.
MATH 361.title: Introduction to Mathematical Biology

MATH 400.name: MATH 400
MATH 400.prereqText: One of MATH 300, MATH 305 and one of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312.
MATH 400.title: Applied Partial Differential Equations

MATH 401.name: MATH 401
MATH 401.prereqText: Either (a) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312 or (b) MATH 400.
MATH 401.title: Green's Functions and Variational Methods

MATH 404.name: MATH 404
MATH 404.prereqText: MATH 300 and a score of 68% or higher in MATH 321.
MATH 404.title: Harmonic Analysis I

MATH 405.name: MATH 405
MATH 405.prereqText: One of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312.
MATH 405.title: Numerical Methods for Differential Equations

MATH 406.name: MATH 406
MATH 406.prereqText: One of MATH 307, CPSC 302 and either (a) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH 256, MATH 257, MATH 316, MATH 358, MECH 358, PHYS 312 or (b) MATH 400.
MATH 406.title: Variational and Approximate Methods in Applied Mathematics

MATH 418.name: MATH 418
MATH 418.prereqText: A score of 68% or higher in MATH 321.
MATH 418.title: Probability

MATH 420.name: MATH 420
MATH 420.prereqText: A score of 68% or higher in MATH 321.
MATH 420.title: Real Analysis I

MATH 423.name: MATH 423
MATH 423.prereqText: MATH 323 and a score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 412, MATH 422.
MATH 423.title: Commutative Algebra

MATH 424.name: MATH 424
MATH 424.prereqs: (MATH 223 || MATH 152 || MATH 221) && (MATH 227 || MATH 217 || MATH 254 || MATH 264 || MATH 317)
MATH 424.prereqText: Either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 223 or (b) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH 152, MATH 221;  and either (a) a score of 68% or higher in MATH 227 or (b) a score of 80% or higher in one of MATH 217, MATH 254, MATH 264, MATH 317.
MATH 424.title: Classical Differential Geometry

MATH 426.name: MATH 426
MATH 426.prereqText: A score of 68% or higher in all of MATH 321, MATH 322.
MATH 426.title: Introduction to Topology

MATH 440.name: MATH 440
MATH 440.prereqText: MATH 300 and a score of 68% or higher in MATH 320.
MATH 440.title: Complex Analysis

MATH 442.name: MATH 442
MATH 442.prereqText: 3rd year standing and one of MATH 220, MATH 223, MATH 226 or CPSC 221.
MATH 442.title: Graphs and Networks

MATH 443.name: MATH 443
MATH 443.prereqText: A score of 68% or higher in one of MATH 220, MATH 223, MATH 226, CPSC 121. And 6 credits of MATH numbered 300 or above.
MATH 443.title: Graph Theory

MATH 444.name: MATH 444
MATH 444.prereqText: One of MATH 220, MATH 226 and 6 credits of MATH courses numbered 300 or higher.
MATH 444.title: Mathematical Research and Writing
